sub_title: Associate Professor, Intelligent Railway Infrastructure, Delft University of Technology
summary:
Alfredo Núñez (IEEE Membership: M’02-SM’14) is currently an Associate Professor in Intelligent Railway Infrastructures at the Delft University of Technology in The Netherlands. Dr. Núñez received a Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Chile in 2010, was a postdoctoral researcher with the Delft Center for Systems and Control, and has been a visiting scholar at universities in Slovenia, Italy, Spain, Chile, Colombia, China, and the USA.

Dr. Núñez has published over a hundred international journal and international conference papers in the field of intelligent transportation systems, including the fields of intelligent railway infrastructure, railway engineering, computational intelligence (neural networks, fuzzy logic, and evolutionary computation), structural health monitoring, maintenance of engineering structures, control of railway systems, asset management of transportation infrastructures, big data, and optimization.

The research of Dr. Núñez has been funded by the Dutch Research Council, the Dutch Railway Infrastructure Manager (ProRail), and various other sources, including European projects such as NeTIRail-INFRA, In2Track3, and IAM4RAIL for which Dr. Núñez was task leader in the development of wayside, onboard and crowd-based railway measurements technologies, railway track simulations, monitoring and maintenance, and railway infrastructure sensing and analytics technologies.

Dr. Núñez belongs to the Editorial Board of the journals IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems - IEEE (Associate Editor), Applied Soft Computing - Elsevier (Editorial Board Member) and Intelligent Transportation Infrastructure - Oxford Academic (Editorial Board Member), has been guest editor of two special issues in the journal Wear - Elsevier (CM2018 and CM2022), and guest editor for other journals.

Updated CV: http://www.alfredonunez.net/files/CVANunez.pdf
Updated publication list: http://www.alfredonunez.net/files/PublicationsAnunez.pdf

In October 2018, I fulfilled all my tenure-track-related agreements and received a unanimous recommendation from the VLC committee for promotion.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor (UD), Data-based Maintenance for Railway Infrastructure

profile_positions.description:
Permanent Full-time Assistant Professor (researcher/docent) 
Section of Railway Engineering
Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences
Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands. 

Research field: Structural condition monitoring and maintenance of railway infrastructure

I have participated in the H2020 project Needs Tailored Interoperable Railway NeTIRail-INFRA. My roles were applicant, participant of WP2, WP4 and WP5, and workpackage leader in the development of new sensor technologies (static, moving and crowd-based sensors) for rural railway networks in Romania, Turkey and Slovenia.  Duration: 36 Months, Jun. 2015 - Jun. 2018. Keywords: Rail, track, overhead power supply, smart technology, societal impact, economics, decision support tools.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor (researcher/docent), Monitoring and Maintenance of Railway Infrastructure

profile_positions.description:
Full-time researcher
Section of Railway Engineering
Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences
Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands. 

Topic: Monitoring and control of large-scale railway infrastructures.
Supervisor: Prof. Zili Li, https://www.tudelft.nl/staff/z.li/

I have participated as a researcher, supervisor of Ph.D. researchers, and supporting management activities in the projects Dr. Track, ADMIRE, and PYRAMIDS. The projects were a partnership with ProRail (Dutch railway inframanager), and NWO Social Sciences and Technology Foundation STW (Dutch organizations for scientific research). See more information at http://www.explorail.nl/  Feb. 2013- Feb. 2016.

I was responsible instructor of the course Knowledge-based control systems, a 3TU course taught at the TUDelft, and broadcasted to students at TU/Eindhoven and University of Twente.
profile_positions.title: Researcher, Rail Systems and Monitoring

profile_positions.description:
Full-time post-doctoral researcher
Delft Center for Systems and Control
Faculty Mechanical, Maritime and Materials Engineering
Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands. 

Topic: Hierarchical and distributed model-based predictive control. Applications to urban and freeway traffic control. 
Supervisor: Prof. Bart De Schutter http://www.dcsc.tudelft.nl/~bdeschutter/

I had the chance to participate as a postdoc and to support management activities in the project Hierarchical and distributed model predictive control of large-scale systems (HD-MPC), European 7th framework STREP, Feb. 2010 - Sept. 2011.  I also participated as a postdoc in the project Highly-complex and networked control systems (HYCON2), EU Network of Excellence, Sept. 2010- Jan. 2013.

I was a teaching assistant in the courses Optimization in Systems and Control and Modeling and Nonlinear Systems Theory.
profile_positions.title: Post-Doc Researcher, Systems and Control
